decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of five years from the date of this permission.  REASON:	In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990. | All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building.  REASON:	To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B1, B5, ES6, Replacement UDP Policy 4.1. | The extension permitted shall not be used or occupied at any time other than for purposes ancillary to the residential use of the dwelling known as 1 Thames Avenue, Greenford.  REASON:	To ensure that the character of the area is preserved and a separate dwelling is not created, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B1, B5, H11, H26, T50, T63, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1, 5.5, 5.6, 5.9, 9.1, 9.11, 9.12. | The garage accommodation shall be retained and shall not be used for living purposes or for any other use (including industrial, commercial or business use).  REASON:  To ensure that adequate parking accommodation is retained within the site and the use of the garage does not by reason of any other activity harm the living conditions in the area, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B1, B5, T50, T63, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1, 9.11, 9.12. | Notwithstanding the details of the first floor part of the extension shown on the submitted plans, no part of the roof shall overhang the side boundary of the site.  The first floor extension shall be set back from the side boundary to ensure this.  Details of this set back shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority before the development is commenced and the details as may be approved shall be implemented as approved.  REASON:  To ensure that all parts of the development are contained within the site boundary, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B1, B5, B8, B9, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1, 5.5, 5.9. | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the building permitted.  REASON: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties and the visual appearance of the area, in accordance with Unitary Development Plan (UDP) Adopted Policies B1, B5, H33, Replacement UDP Policies 4.1, 5.5, 5.9.
description: Two storey extension to side and side/rear of house, following removal of existing single storey side and side/rear extension
